title: U.S. Recommends Release of Treasury Data, Non-Consensus Investing, Collapse of Liberal Capitalism
itunes:title: U.S. Recommends Release of Treasury Data, Non-Consensus Investing, Collapse of Liberal Capitalism
description:
Bloomberg News Bond and FX Reporter Liz Capo McCormick and Bloomberg News Bond Reporter Alex Harris discuss news that the U.S. government has decided to recommend publicly releasing data on Treasuries trading volume. Rupal Bhansali, Chief Investment Officer for International and Global Equities at Ariel Investments, explains how to be right in investing when everyone else is wrong. Andy Browne, Bloomberg New Economy Editorial Director, explains the alternative to liberal capitalism, which is Chinese-style state capitalism featuring top-down economic and political controls. Bloomberg News Reporter Margaret Newkirk talks about startup Padsplit‘s vision of future of low-cost housing with single-family homes. And we Drive to the Close with Tom Plumb, Portfolio Manager at Plumb Funds.

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly. Producer: Paul Brennan.
